Hi, I`m Marcin

Beginner front-end developer based in Lodz, Poland. Without commercial experience yet but I decided to change this state of affairs.

That's why I prepared a kind of "personalized business card" to introduce myself.

The form of website which you're looking at now is my own idea. I've tried to present myself, describe technologies I have came across and put covering letter in one place. I also invite you to visit my “wall” with certificates. I'm aware they are not making an impression yet but they look good in frame. If you would like to know my hobbies closer, visiting gallery with sample photos taken by me is a good choice. But one of more interesting item on website in my opinion is filterable list of projects where you can check my works.

Furthermore ...

I implemented analog watch, a code of which I found on the Internet and brought it to life on my website.
I posted contact form. Yes, it's here and works based on the free Formsubmit's service. I will be grateful for any message even for a test 🙂. Nevertheless, If you would like to contact me in more formal cases I suggest sending email by safer webmail service ( contact to me can be found under “cv” icon ).
I almost forgot. Theme changed to dark if you click on the moon. Your choice will be saved in local storage of your web browser as default.

Well, that's it! I am still working to improve my website. It`s a second version where I tried to clean up my code, follow the DRY rule and implement BEM methodology. Even though I haven't finished my "business card" yet, I've decided that it should see the light of a day right now. Thanks for being here. I hope you enjoy discovering this place and please take a look at the news window!

👋 Greetings!

ABOUT ME

Currently, I am working as a purchasing specialist in the automotive industry. We produce extruded aluminum car roof rails for world-renowned brands. From purchasing side I am responsible for developing new projects, suppliers selection, realization of purchase requisitions for various production areas, looking for opportunities of savings and price negotiations. In addition, a large part of my work is based on Enterprise Resources Planning software like SAP.

I graduated from the Technical University of Lodz, engineer by education. The knowledge gained at the university taught me logical thinking, cooperation with others, not giving up, patience and many aspects of technical knowledge which I use cooperating with technical department and suppliers.

I have been interested in computers and technical innovations since an early age. More in hardware than software formerly. And a few years ago, I desired to try or create something new. I came across a product called Raspberry Pi. Small programmable computer. Then I thought - programming maybe? I bought a book by Michael Dawson, by which I had my first contact with Python programming language. Because of private and professional reasons the adventure did not last too long and I did not buy a little raspberry in the end. But I wrote some very simple working lines of code.

After several years of working in a corporation, I came to the point when I realized that it is not the place where I would like to spend the rest of my professional career. The idea of programming came back. I like to face of challenges and decided to become a programmer. I have a strong motivation to gain new knowledge and experience. In my opinion programming is based on logical thinking and requires constant searching for solutions which I personally like so much. Rapidly changing technology forces constant learning, requires self-development what gives a lot of satisfaction. Moreover, I am motivated by the possibility of remote working. Coding anywhere, exploring the world and meeting interesting people.

I chose front-end technologies and JavaScript language because I like creating and seeing immediate effects of my work. I have a fairly sense of aesthetics in my opinion and I like to take care of details. JavaScript is a versatile programming language and gives many opportunities for further development. It is usable on the front and backend. Despite complexity of JavaScript, it was a good choice. I see the capabilities to be a Fullstack Developer or take my chances at other technologies in the future.

Unfortunately, I currently have no commercial programming experience yet. However, I hope that will change soon. I am also aware of the current popularity of looking for a job in IT and number of applicants for Junior Developer. Nevertheless I am determined and highly motivated. I would really love to start working as programmer and have the opportunity to spend more time programming. I believe that someday my potential be noticed/appreciated and I will be able to spread my wings.

Technologies I have came across as beginner
I have knowledge about the structure of websites, its markup and semantics.
I have no difficulty in using selectors and styling HTML elements. I can also create a Responsive Web Design.
I understand the basics and concepts of JavaScript language such as: variables, functions, loops, arrays, events, asynchronous JS, DOM, classes, references and OOP.
I can simplify and split styles by using preprocessor's variables, partials, nested rules, mixins and media queries.
I understand read documentation so I know how to use library like Bootstrap to build simply RWD layout of website.
Probably I know a tiny fraction of git's command and capabilities but at the moment it is enough for me to create commits and simple projects.
I use npm as a package manager to manage the frontend layer of created pages.
I understand main idea of components. I can create a simple application using React library and JSX syntax. Unfortunately, I had a break with React but currently in the process of refreshing my knowledge in this technology.
I understand how application's state are managed by Redux, unfortunately without much experience in practice.
Elementary knowledge of storing data on the server and downloading them dynamically.
I can use simple Handlebars to compile templates into JavaScript functions.
I understand the general assumptions of the language, but after one online tutorial I can't be proud of my skills in this area. I hope that will change soon because I know how important that language is right now.
I have a little experience working with Webpack. But I understand the idea of creating "tasks" to get started working on the project. Probably more often I used Parcell.

Projects

Select a project from the list...

To-Do

To-do app for adding and editing targets . With ability to add separate groups. Included filtering and searching for a tasks. Moreover, additional subpages for add some notes. App was written in an older version of React. I am moving it to a separate repo "Student Shelf" and developing in the latest React 18, Redux and Router versions. Works in progress.

My part in this project:
  • I created some function and class components
  • refactoring of lists and columns
  • data migration to Redux
  • functionality of adding columns
  • development of filtering functionality
  • implementation of React Router

Home Budget

An application where the user can create his own account and monitor home budget. The data are saved in the browser's local storage so after refreshing the page whole transactions are saved. In addition, you can create accounts for all family members and exchange founds. Withdrwals and deposits are described by colors and icons. Moreover I tried to use the MVC architecture.

Taboo Game

Taboo game prepared for a friend who uses it to teach English his students. Substantive content of taboo cards like answers and taboo words by an English teacher.

How to play: guess the main password without using words from the list.

Pizzeria

Website of a fictitious pizzeria with the ability to choosing pizza ingredients, placing orders, booking tables, adding products to the basket and checking the orders.

My part in this project:
  • generating DOM elements
  • dropdown product menu
  • calculation of product prices with selected ingredients
  • visualization of ingredients after adding to the product
  • development of the widget class and validation of values
  • development of the cart class
  • summary of order to be sent to the server
  • development of booking table section
